greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of odd-indexed Fibonacci numbers in the Zeckendorf representation of n.
comment: We begin the indexing at 2; that is, 1=F(2), 2=F(3), 3=F(4), 5=F(5), ...
For a count of even-indexed Fibonacci summands, see A165276.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: fibOddCount[n_] := Plus @@ (Reverse@IntegerDigits[n, 2])[[2 ;; -1 ;; 2]]; fibOddCount /@ Select[Range[1000], BitAnd[#, 2 #] == 0 &] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 20 2020 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Sep 12 2009
